alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 3:25AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Heavy Snow & Hazardous Travel Today & Tonight... .Overnight bands of snow have provided 2 to 4 inches of snow accumulations in spots and resulted in slippery to hazardous snow covered roads. This heavy snow will continue through the morning commute as increased snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches likely across parts of northeast Iowa and southwest into central Wisconsin. Morning commute motorists should exercise caution especially along and south of Interstate 90. Heavy snow persists this afternoon and evening, gradually shifting east of the Mississippi River into central Wisconsin tonight. The bulk of the accumulating snow will exit into eastern Wisconsin by midnight tonight. Highest overall storm total accumulations of 9 to 12 inches from northeast Iowa into southwest and central Wisconsin may result in downed trees and power outages. In addition, northwest winds will increase with gusts 30 to 40 mph at times this afternoon through tonight. As a result, blowing and drifting snow may rapidly reduce visibilities and driving conditions especially along unsheltered areas and ridgetops. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow, with additional accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
